newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Moroccan blue chips drive bourse higher.
newsitem.headline: Moroccan blue chips drive bourse higher.

text.p: Morocco's blue chip companies drove the Casablanca bourse higher on Wednesday, traders said.
The all-share index closed at 429.76 points, up from 429.08 points on Tuesday.
The main stock to gain was that of Eqdom credit company which rose 31 dirhams to 1,070 dirhams from 1,039 dirhams on the previous session.
Eqdom announced on Monday it was to increase its capital to 166.6 million ($19.1 million) from 111.1 million dirhams. It said the capital would be increased via a stock split and rights issue.
"Despite stagnation of some of the largest market capitalisations like ONA Group, the bourse index continued its upward trend pushed up mainly by the banking sector," a stockbroker said.
ONA, Morocco's largest private group which holds stakes in more than 100 firms, remained stable at 460 dirhams.
Banque Commerciale du Maroc, the country's second largest bank, rose six dirhams to close at 676 dirhams.
In its audited balance published on Wednesday, BCM said turnover rose 5.8 percent to 1.289 billion dirhams ($148.1 million) in the first half of 1996 from a year earlier.
The bank also posted profit of 271.7 million dirhams in the first half of the year but gave no comparison with the same period in 1995.
Brasseries du Maroc, a leading brewery, gained 20 dirhams to close at 1,400 dirhams.
The traded volume on the official market was 19.02 million dirhams, up from 13.9 million on the previous session, a bourse official said.
